content:
Posted: February 19, 2014
												I'll break my review into two parts; the pro and cons.Pro:1) Addictive game. Very fun to play and never gets boring2) Great customization. Shields, speed, attack damage, attack speed, critical damage, etc. Almost everything on your ship is customizable. If you lose, it's your own fault. Not the game's.Cons1) Community and GMs. You can chat about anything you want on SC...if the right GM is online. You will be banned from chatting (for 1 hour) if you write things the GMs disagree about. For example, A) On the US server you can only type in English. Typing in Spanish or any other language will get you banned for an hour. B) Be very careful of your political comments. I have seen people get banned for mentioning "Obama" or "Obamacare". You are free to say anything about Romney though. C) If you want to kick back and chat instead of dog fighting all day, you can get banned for chatting too much. D) if you chat about how much the exchanges in the game cost (cash for standards) you will get banned.E) Complaining about the launch time for pve or pvp will get you banned.Btw, the term "Ban" in the above comments mean you won't be able to type in the chat for one hour. You can still play but you can't talk.Summary, great game but horrible GMs.

content:
Posted: July 16, 2016
												Star Confict Game star conflict ini adalah game yang bergenre DMMO dan action game , yang dimana kita sebagai pengemudi kapal perang luar angkasa untuk betarung melawan musuh .berawal dari galaksi yang dibagi antara kerajaan bintang militan dsn kelompok tentara bayaran independen , dimana banyak galksi - galaksi yang sudah di tinggalkan dan di pakai sebagai base dari tentara bayaran independen , perebutan galaksi pun terjadi dimana terbagi dalam 3 koloni yaitu empire , federation dan jericho .penilaian :gameplay :menurut saya gameplaynya menarik , luamayan seru juga , gak ada storyline game ini soalnya ini game onlinegame ini bisa di maintain dengan 2 mode view yaitu “TPS” dan “FPS” , banyak fitur” menarik di game ini karena ini game perang kapal luar angkasa jadi banyak sekali pilihan kapal - kapal perang yang dapat di beli. kita    harus mengikuti prosedur - prosedur jika ingin membeli kapal , (seperti jika membeli kapal ini , kapal sebelumya    yang kita pakai harus menvcapai level 5) , tidak semua kapal bisa di beli dalam game , ada beberapa kapal yang   bebentuk DLC berbayar yang harus di beli jika mau membeli kapal tersebut , jika berminat bisa membelinya di   steam store . dalam pemilihan kapal juga ada yang namanya "DIVISI" , jadi kapal - kapal tersebut memiliki jenismasing - masing serti kapal tipe "fighter" ,"interceptor","guarded", dll . setiap kapal pun memiliki rank - rank jadi   berurut secara bertingkat. setiap kapal memiliki senjata dan skil - skill yang berbeda - beda dan juga  bisa upgradeagar lebih baik dalam bertempur . Game ini di bagi menjadi 2 mode  play yaitu "PvP" dan "PvE" atau bisa di   bilang "PvAI" , maksimal dalam pertempurang adalah 24 prang (12 v 12 ) dan minimumnya ( 2 v 2 ) . tempat yang di   pakai dalam pertempuran sudah pasti luar angkasa , tetapi ada banyak tempat yang dapat kita tempati secara  random atau acak , dalam pemilihan tempat juga harus memperhitungkan  level , semakin tinggi level kita kita akan   dapat mengunlock tempat - tempat . yang terakhir adalah "level" level dalam game ini berbentuk dalam "rank" dan   dilihat bukan dari exp tapi dari rank saat membeli kapal tempur  luar angkasa , jadi semakin kita membeli kapal   dengan rank tertinggi , semakin tinggi rank kita dan bisa meng unlock tempat - tempat dan fitur - fitur lainnya .grafik 	:grafik game ini menurut saya luamayan bagus dan bisa dimainkan dengan pc atau laptop yg ber-kartu grafis rendahkriteria minimum dan rekomendasi bisa di lihat langsung di steamstorenya efek - efek dalam pertempuran juga sangat keren pastinya dengan fitur - fitur ledakan , laser - laser , dll kelebihan : - fitur - fitur dalam game yang menarik - tidak terlalu sering update - dapat dimainkan oleh pengguna pc atau laptop berkartu grafis rendah *tidak di bawah 512mb- memiliki banyak jenis kapas - DLC nya juga menarik - Kapal - kapal luar angkasanya keren - keren bentuknya - bisa memodifikasi warna kapal - tidak terlalu sulit dalam "PvE" kekurangan : - bukan game steam jadi harus membuat account di tempat lain yang memakan waktu - pemainnya tidak terlalu banyak - dalam searching game kadang bisa diatas 2 menit - banyak kapal - kapal yang dalam bentuk DLC berbayar - memakai mode "TOP UP"- dapat membosankankesimpulan : jika kalian pecinta game perang kapal luar angkasa , game ini sangat cocok untuk dimainkan , game ini gratis di steam store jadi dapat di jangkau oleh semua pengguna steam , atau dapat download di http://star-conflict.com/en/		    game/aboutsharkql

content:
Posted: December 22, 2014
												I remember playing this game almost one year ago. Back then, it was very intense! Tons of flight controls, but suprisingly easy to learn, and although it looked cpu heavy, it was rather nice to the lower end computers. I can't tell you the number of times i was riding just 2 feet away from a structure, riding so close to it in order to make my chaser trip up or when you narrowly avoid everyone riding your behind with one well timed defensive active ability and some creative manuver. However, it clearly has degraded into a truely pittiful game. It use to be a very actiony game, where your skills, guts, timing, and location mattered more then any gun or ship you accually used. Bahh, now it has degraded into such a pay to play pithole, where the opposite is true. Dam, I don't know what all went wrong over that one year, but i can smell that something has, be it different (and incompetent) management, or this was there original plan from the begining. Use to be one of the most fun games ever, now it's borderline trash.

content:
Posted: January 14, 2015
												Its fun for a few minutes, then it gets frustratingly hard to progress, and even when you do, its not rewarding.It takes forever to get paired up in a matchIf you play PvP, you die a lot and don't get xpIf you play PvE, some opped-out Russian steals all your kills and you don't get xpIf you play exploration/out-of-match questing, you don't get xp, money or any satisfaction whatsoeverThe only way to get xp/money is to buy membership to double the miniscule ammount of xp/money you do get.Don't spend money to buy ships; they're no better than any others. Gold-class ships only have to perk of generating extra synergy which (yes you guessed it) you have to pay more money to transfer to your other ships because they start off maxxed (which also does nothing).No matter how much time and energy you put into upgrading your ships, there will always be at least 10 other people in your match who paid real money to get overpowered weapons, ships, and modules to be a million times better than you.Community sucks.Customer support sucks unless you're Russian.Guard ships and Long-Range ships are rediculously OP, especially in PvPThe only way you progress is being really good or paying money; there's no graduation of difficulty, or benefits for new players; its hard right away, and stays hard.Perks:-the combat is cool when you're not dying constantly-3D movement is cool as well, but would be cooler if the scenery didn't force you to think in a 2D manner.-stars-yelling at your teammates for wiping the group1/10 you could easily skip this one

content:
Posted: April 20, 2014
												It isn't open world. Just individual small maps. There is nothing but combat, no exploration or trading etc. You just spawn again when you die and you play in short "Red Vs Blue" matches where you could end up on either team. Not a lot to this game to be honest i was expecting more. Also the flight controls are very arcadey even when set to "EXPERT".  If you are looking for a Space combat game with simulation type controls this is not for you. Also there are nearly a dozen types of currency which is about ten too many.If you are looking for Call of Duty style deathmacthes in Space then this is it. It's very similar to Mech Warrior Online in many aspects (except for the respawning), but in a space game i dont like being boxed into a tiny map. Personally not what i want in a space game.

content:
Posted: July 4, 2013
												Unless you want an exercise in frustration with Pay2Win tactics, patching that changes the entire premise of the game and generally frustrating gameplay and teammates, stay away from this absolute pile of♥♥♥♥♥♥ There are NO MMO attributes in it, it's basically a FPS in space with traditional pay2win characteristics. Unless you want to drop $100, stay away. NOT A FREE GAME.To make matters worse, getting items (a.k.a. loot) is now a pay-to-win system too. Here's how you get items: Win, firstly. Then you have 3 'chances' to uncover items, usually finding 'debris' which is just vendor trash that sells for 10% of market value. THEN you have to 'recover' any items you actually found, which is a 10% chance to do so. 30% if you want to pay real money. So you have a 50% chance, then a 30% chance and a 10% chance on top of that. Do the math friends, stay away from this Russian piece of crap.

number of helpful: 4 of 8 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 27, 2014
												NIce idea, bad approach.Game play has a steep learning curve, if you can get past the curve it can be fun.  The tiers for PVE are too large, after tier 4 there is 5 ranks of ships to top of tier and all PVE encouters are based on rank 9. This mean you'll have to level most of your 4-8 ships with bonus experience.  I presume from 10-15 will be much the same.  Open world is extremely difficult under rank 6-7 and the difficulty scales up rapidly.Modules require multiple faction credit and it costs to change factions.Leveling without cash shop is near impossible past rank 6, and the caash shop prices are too expensive.  No micro purchases, everything is in the 5-50 dollar range.Terrible group ques for PVP. Want to play with a group of friends, more than one will see regular 5+ minute wait times.

content:
Posted: January 29, 2015
												This is one of those games that I love the idea for, but it is sadly ruined for the use of Pay 2 Win.I was in the middle of a round, when I died. I was like "Okay, I guess I'll try again." But nope, I immediately see a message saying something like "You can ressurrect your ship with a duplicator, or you can wait till the next round." I'm sorry, but that is a terrible Pay-2-Win method. You can't learn from your mistakes if you have to pay money to get back into the action. And I'm not waiting 15 minutes to get to the next round while I sit back and watch my other team mates with way better items than me having a good time. I actually wouldn't mind spending a few $ on this game. But that message alone ticked me off to the point of uninstalling it.

												A great game with a decent concept that's plagued by a horrible progression system that encourages you to trend towards microtransactions. content:
Posted: November 2, 2016
												Star Conflict is a third person space combat game. The game currently features some PvP, PvE and PvAI scenarios. You get to pick one of three factions, Jericho, Federation and Empire, each with unique stats on their ships. The combat in Star Conflict feels solid, there's always bullets, plasma, lasers and rockets flying in all directions, and it's ships do not fly like Star Wars, as they fly like planes in space, here ships can remain still, move in all directions without limitations. You get to pick one of three ship types at first, Interceptor, Fighter and Frigate, from smallest to biggest.The game itself puts heavy focus on team work. PvE Missions and PvP requires some co-ordination with your team. Truth be told, when a team works together they are unstoppable. My favorite type of ships are the Fighters, and it's role Tacklers, focusing mostly on throwing de-buffs and cloacking behind enemy lines. This game is to be experienced with friends and comrades, and if you need someone to guide you, let me know, In-game my nick is Richyda. PS: If you wish, use this code to be my refferal, you instantly get me into your friend list, so would be easier to contact one another.D42BF26E5AFF755DBE6571472126F2A7 Use it just when you are about to select your starting faction, thanks!

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 3, 2013
												I used to like playing this game, because it was an action arcade 3rd person space shooter. Ticking all the right boxes of my predilections. However, after a few updates, the game became grindy very quickly. You now have to use ships incessantly to get “synergy” which upgrades them, unless you buy a premium ship. Repairs cost money unless you buy premium. I stopped playing for a few months and then went back with the new update. Wow was I surprised, they have now made the game 1000% more grind orientated. You used to upgrade ships based on usage, it was free. Now you need to grind for it, not just for synergy but faction synergy, or you can use universal synergy with cost money. You also have to grind to upgrade ship components, oh and with multiple requirements, or you can pay.Instead of working on ship balancing or gameplay fun or even matchmaking queues (as the wait times for a match are ridiculous), all attention is focused on money and how to squeeze more from you. Oh and forget about the free roam stuff, that has a limit installed, you can only do a few missions per day, and then you have to wait for it to reset. Yep, loads of fun right?!Honestly I'm surprised they haven't monetised the log in.Stay away from this rubbish.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 18, 2014
												Update 6/20/16Lol holy♥♥♥♥♥♥this game is a ♥♥♥♥ing joke. The grinding is actuallythe worst setup I've ever seen in a game. Either spend hours, literally consecutively for months all day every day, playing the game to make slow progress, or make none at all and try to play it casually. Teamwork is non existant, if you're a frigate in PvP glhf. Even if you use a good PvP ship for your level with maxed equipment, the ranking system is absolutely horrible. I queued with all rank 7 ships and was thrown in a game where the vast majority had rank 10+ ships, and I know it's not based on survivability because theirs was obviously signifigantly higher than mine was. Open world is still unbalanced as all Hell, lower level players can't leave the station without getting destroyed. Leveling up makes absolutely no sense. I take that back, I'm sure you can figure it out after hours of messing around in the game, but they really never explain the leveling system at all other than what synergy is and how to buy new ships. I logged on to get my reward and had no new guns or equipment from the last time had logged on, then logged off. I logged on 30 minutes later only to have randomly unlocked a slew of new equipment and alien weapons that was apparently supposed to be automatically given to me once I got a rank 7 ship, which I have several of. The new support ships are really cool, the only downside is that the grind for them takes so damn long. They came out late last year and I just talked to a casual player, someone who doesn't waste their time playing this game nonstop, and he told me he started manufacturing his support ship the day he could and he was just recently able to finish it last week. They're cool and all but for the grind it couldn't be any less worth it. The transfer rate for GS to credits is still a huge slap in the face, there's honeslty no need to explain just check for yourself or take my word. It seems like the devs did a great job improving the handling of the ships and hit registration, however with every update they seem to find a way to make the grind even harder if you don't supply them with a constant flow of cash.I'd also like to add that they still haven't made the game any more enjoyable for new players. I stopped playing this game for months and when I came back I was able to get back into it pretty easily. My friend however had only played enough to get a rank 2 ship and getting into the game was just impossible. I queued with him usuing a rank 2 ship and we were against players that were in rank 4-5 ships PvP and with rank 4-5 ships in PvE which made the difficulty harder. Tiers 1 and 2 are still as awful as they always have been since they made it pay to win and it doesn't look like they're planning on changing that, making it offputting to new players. Tier 3 is better but there is a noticable difference between rank 7 and rank 8 ships that can make some battles very unbalanced. A new weapon added during my hiatus, the Flux Phaser, makes playing certain fighters a whole lot easier. I for example love using it on my Commander ships because it allows me to keep good distance and deal signifgant damage. A lot of people seem to think the weapon is overpowered, mainly because they've been hit by more than one ship using a Phaser at once, but this brings up the teamwork aspect of this game. There is a video on YouTube of a coordinated team all using Phasers and they were melting ships in seconds, but that would happen with pretty much every weapon because they were focusing their fire on one or two ships at a time. The weapon itself is pretty balanced, the only real edge it has is that it's extremely easy to master using because of it fires homing shots. If you think that's OP then you have to think the beam cannon is OP because its a ♥♥♥♥ing 100% accurate laser that travels at the speed of light that progressively gets stronger over time. My only complaint about the Flux Phaser is that I don't like how wierd it can be to shoot. Sometimes when I'm in a fight and spamming it I'll run into issues like the shot popping too early or the shot being fired when I let go of LBM then instantly popping. Other than that it's fun. I have't gotten to really look at the Mass Driver yet, the new weapon for frigates (at least I think it is, I never saw when I used to play), but I can't say it's something I think will be usefull on all frigates. For example I'm not sure I'd put it on my Guard ship because of the low rate of fire and weaker damage. Its better on LRF's which can shoot faster and need a good close range weapon other than the Beam Cannon to deal with Interceptors and Fighters that get too close.Pros:Great flight mechanicsGreat fighting mechanicsGreat graphics, especially for a F2PA cool ranking system with the potential to be funNice communityA good amount of eventsFun missionsCons:Hardcore pay to winUnbalanced matchmakingExtremely tedious grindNew ships are always high rank shipsVeteran friendly, very hard for new players to get into and enjoyEvents usually require a specific weapon or skill level that only higher level players would haveThe occasional♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥All that aside I'll still play it casually, I just can't recommend anyone get into the game unless they're willing to dish out some dough and put a♥♥♥♥♥♥ton of hours into the game.------------------------------------------{Old review}I can no longer suggest this game to new players after the last few updates.You can no longer pick your teammates up in PvE mode unless you have a one time use duplicator, which is a waste of time and money to get just to revive one person. (A lot of people at higher ranks have hundreds, but it's still an uneccessary addition to the game that only serves the purpose of adding a little extra difficulty to the grind.)Missile launchers in PvE respawn almost instantly making it ridiculously hard. (fixed to a degree)The open world idea is good, but it has no balance. If you go in with an Interceptor, you have the speed to get out of fights, but not enough defense/power to survive. If you use a Fighter, you have decent power and defense, but you're still too slow to escape the sometimes brutal skirmishes with NPC's. If you go in with a Frigate, you have the power and defense to fight, but you're far too slow you run away if you have to. (♥♥♥♥ you)This may just be me, but since the last time I got on, I've noticed a sharp decrease in the amount of synergy and credits I get after a fight. I got a premium license to see if I could get more syn/creds and it just ended up giving me the normal amount from before. (♥♥♥♥. you.)I want to like this game, I really do, but the developers have finally set it up where it is completely pay to win. To survive PvE, you need a premium ship and duplicators. To survive skirmishes, you need a premium ship with a ton of active module spots. To survive open world, you once again need a premium ship with extra module spots. If you want any synergy or creds, you need to buy a premium license. This game was really fun when it first came out, now it's no different than the other F2P games on Steam. Get out your credit card or go home.

content:
Posted: November 28, 2014
												The core part of this game is fun and I'll continue to pick and poke at it despite not recommending it, to anyone, ever.For whatever reason, it is not possible to play on a server that offers a lag free gaming environment.  The dev's have decided that they want shorter queing times, even if this means that the matches you are given are routinely unplayable due to terrible server destinations.  I've checked this out on the game's forums, and many people complain about it.  The devs claim everything is "working as intended".The really annoying thing about this is that players are heavily penalized by server side lag.  If you tough it out and stay in a laggy match, your personal stats suffer, and your progression is slowed.   If you leave a laggy match, you're locked out of looking for a new one until the old match expires.  Though it hasn't happened to me, I've heard a lot of talk about people facing temperary bans for leaving matches that are simply unplayable.This issue could be cleared up with a larger player base, maybe...  I can't imagine the path Star Conflict would take to get those players.  Since the game is free to play, new players have no vested interesting in completely what could be a 1000+ hours of grind on servers that seem to be positioned somewhere between where you want to play from, and the moon.War Thunder, also from Giajin, is an all around better game for those looking for something fun and free to play.

Its not that I'm upset that I lost, I'm just upset at not having a chance. Even in Dark Souls there are ways to grind and, as the youth says, "Git gud".-So many other good space games coming out. They aren't arcadey like this. Look up Star Citizen or No Man's Sky, if you haven't already. Angel's Fall First is another game to take a quick look at.-RepetitiveHope this helped some of y'all. If you really want to take a look at Star Conflict, go ahead! Its free to play, and you might enjoy yourself for a little bit, so no harm done. This is just my honest review. 												The game has an interesting concept and potential but is far away from being finished (still in beta) and playable.At first it is fun to play this space action game as it has depth and takes some strategy to win.But soon you'll realize that this game is unbalanced, matchmaking is awful and servers are terrible.The lack of players especially in non-Russian territories makes this game even more difficult to play with long wait times for matches.The open beta is going on for a year or longer and the game still doesn't have a release date yet. Don't get fooled by the progression (ship ranks) take your time to get to higher ranks and fully level/synergize all your ships.

content:
Posted: February 3, 2014
												The game when starting was AWESOME, basically the same stuff than War Thunder but with space-ships.The controls are kinda hard when beggining but when you get used to them they are really funny and entretaining.A lot of ships, meaning a lot of game time to get used to each one of them and learning their strong points and flaws, also very entretaining.A some-what great community (at least on global chat).Thats the pretty part of the game... only when you start.After unlocking the third or fourth ship... everything went into the grindfest:1.PvE restricts you to 1 or 2 missions with different difficulty (easier and you dont earn nothing OR impossible and still dont earn a lot), thats why you can do party with low leveled people and take your Tier 5 ship into the first mission on easy.2.PvP is extremely unbalanced, since you can get more than half of new players with Tier 1 ships against a team with Tier 5-6 ships.3.The grind after a while becomes ridiculous, you go from a kinda affordable ship to one that takes WEEKS or even MONTHS to unlock, of course... you have to LV UP the ship that was BEFORE the one that you want to unlock if you want to do so.4.Upgrades follow the same path, since this game was made for people buying memberships that gives boosts (and lets not mention the premium ships which gives an even more insane boost) so you basically have to spend real money constantly to keep the ingame currency on a stable flow, since not only upgrades becomes insanely expensive but the price of the REPAIRS that you must carry to make your ships "usable" again takes at least 60% (If not more) of the battle rewards.5.Lag, yeah, lag, even if this game its not that demanding, there are many situations (and with many means ALL the time) which the screen gets so heavily loaded with effects, explosions and stuff, that either, you end up blind until everything goes away OR you get hard lagged and crash against a random rock floating in the scene.6.Either or you get a incredible win streak (which means the PvP matchmaking working properly, which it never happens.) PLUS membership PLUS premium ships to keep a somewhat "stable" currency flow, or you have to go back to previous Tiers, meaning more and more grinding.7.Faction system is worthless, since you can pay a sum of game currency and simply switch to another faction, same goes for clan wars, there is not a "real" reason of being in one.This game is fun up to a point, after that, it just gets annoying, unless you have fun with hours and hours of grinding, rogue-like teammates that basically are kill-hoggers, which means that if the whole team gets crushed they wont care, they got their kill, DLCS and "I got the most OP premium ship in the game" players, then this is your game.(By the way: this goes for War Thunder too, but with planes.)

number of helpful: 47 of 95 people (49%) found this review helpful12 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: March 26, 2015
												With the start of Season 2 and the exciting arrival of dreadnoughts for inter-corporation battles, I decided I would finally write a review for this awesome game, to which I have devoted a large part of my life for the past year (you decide if that is a good thing or a bad thing ;) ).First of all, why is it a good game? Beautiful graphics: ships maps and backgrounds (tip: press Alt+H in-battle to remove the HUD) PVP, PVE and Invasion (open world) game modes Large variety of maps in all game modes Hundreds of fully customisable ships, with many different types of modules Corperations - the game's clans system It's FREE TO PLAY!!! and definitely not pay to win - all premium ships only offer small advantages over their non-premium counterparts, if any at allWhat is wrong with the game? (it has to be mentioned, despite my love for the game...) Fairly small matches in higher tiers Low population on anything other than EU/RU prime time High ping for US pilots on RU servers and vice versa High grind, but hey? who want a game you can complete in two days?  Also there are plenty of ways to reduce grind by using real money, if that is what you are looking for. Previously I would have said lack of communication on the dev's behalf, but this seems to have changed recently Difficulty to get matches in squads, since with the current system, a squad of the same size as yours has to queue up also, before you can get into a match.Some tips for someone trying the game for the first time: Please try the game until tier 3 (ranks 7-9) at least.  This will give you the best overall view of the game, as t3 is where you get the largest PVP matches, and where most of the intercorporate tournaments happen. Join a corp as soon as you reach t2/t3, and ask around for a corp that uses voice comms.  You can easily find one on the forum.  Joining a corp will help you make friends, and make the most out of the game.  They can give you advice, ship builds, squad with you, and just generally have a good laugh together! The forum has a lot of information. Get involved! Ask questions and the game's veterans will be glad to help you! (maybe your thread will turn into a huge off-topic debate, but that's another matter...) Try all ship types from all factions, before you choose your favourites.  They all have very different playing styles! PVE can be very useful to gain credits rapidly, while PVP is better for synergising (levelling-up) your ships. Watch out in Invasion, there are pilots like mysself lurking around ;) If you just want to farm bots, don't forget to put your station protection on before undocking.  Also don't forget that certain zones have no station protection.I look forward to meeting you on the battlefield! GL and may the biomorphs leave you unmolested!

number of helpful: 14 of 29 people (48%) found this review helpful3 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: April 7, 2015
												After 4000 hours on the game, it's time for a review !I saw a lot of changes in StarConflict in 2 Years. (And looking back, they were all good)There are a lot of people giving "bad review" without understanding completly the game or having see all the content that the game can offer.To prevent the wall of text ! Gameplay : The game propose various ships (3 Classes each divided in 3 differents roles for a total of 9 roles) offering tons of diversity fitting to what you want to do or how you want to play. Secondly, at the difference of most of the other games, you are not limited to 1 ship per battle, you can bring 3 (then 4) differents ships in battle adding much more possibilities and gameplay than any other games.Star Conflict also have various gamemodes :_PvP : 6 differents gamemode (From Team Battle to Capture mode ectect) with 15 different maps (each map have its particularities and design)_PvE : Multiple scenarized missions in group for all levels granting you an easy way to get money and loots (1 garanted loot per day) _Raid : End Game content, there is only 1 available but fighting a big Alien have no price (I don't want to spoil :D)_Open Space (aslo called Invasion) : It's an open world mode where you can fly throught differents sectors, doing missions, collecting ressources, killing others players or NPC (Killing Players is better !) and Aliens ! (Aliens hurt hard)_Tournament : Every Sunday we have multiple tournament that you can join in group or as a Solo Players granting you free Gold Standard (a little amount but its always nice to have them ;) )_Dreadnought : Soon :DFor the Ships:It's extremly easy : Standard Ships or Premium, they all have the same power so there is no problem with them. Each Ship is unique with its own stats and bonuses, you will see each new ship like a new adventure.To detail a bit more, the Ships are divided in 5 Tiers, each tier have 3 Ranks. All ships in ONE tiers can beat each others.And each have its own gameplay, you just need to find the ships corresponding to you :)To answer to some complains about P2W :No, the game isn't P2W. Premium Ships will never garantee you victory, as well they will never grant you better stats.They are interesting if you don't have a lot of time to play to progress a bit faster or support the game. (Note there are tons of sold) Graphism : The Design and the Graphism are really good for a F2P game. It's fast and smooth and pretty cool :DThe game does not require a big computer to be played, it's an enourmous point, even small config can enjoy the game.In more general terms, the game is really well done and "EXPLOOOOOOOOOOOSIONNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNN" !I'm really enjoying the game and it's evolution. The grind is proportionnal to the time you can invest in the game. The more you play, the faster you progress but I prefer to recommand to take your time will progressing. StarConflict is a complete game with a lot of mechanics that you will have to use/understand at a certains points and the community is always here to answer your questions (Chat or on the forums).There are too many things I like in this game and not enough time :D The last thing I can do is this : I can't give you  a better advice than "Test the game by Yourself and make your own opinion, take your time to see everything".It's a F2P game, it will cost you nothing !...Okay, if it's doing the same thing to you than what happened to me, your life and your soul will be captured by the game.

Posted: October 2, 2014
												I'm giving this game the thumbs up purely because I feel that the flight and combat style was the best i've played in quite some time. With the game seamingly more geared towards PvP (like most games nowadays) I felt like the PvE side lacked just a little. PvE had some great missions to play and with each new tier you jumped to in lvl's, you got new and harder missions. I would suggest going with a group of friends as per my experience, the random pugs sat and did nothing half the time just soaking up free XP.. unfortunate.. My biggest gripe with the game was how "grindy" it felt to get anywhere, even with the release of Free Roam (their open world concept) the missions for it felt very "go here, fetch this, drop it here".. Outside of PvE and to the PVP, I don't have any real words other then Carnage and Chaos. Pick something that moves and kill it, before it kills you.

content:
Posted: April 24, 2015
												It is not eve online or star citizen, but it sure as hell comes damn well close.I heard it's from the same publishers as War Thunder and honestly I don't really care. This was a well made game through and through. Flight controls are slick and sharp. The extreme detail that goes into the modeling of the ships is astounding. And your guns even swivel when you move your cursor. They SWIVEL to aim where you are aiming at. Dat SWIVEL.And profesionalism aside, the grinding in this game is acceptable to say the least. Almost four hours into the game and I'm comfortable enough to handle a one on one dogfight with another player. Though I can see myself burning out after my fifth hour after i get the T5. Every ship that I unlock feels the same as the one before, only a tad bit stronger.I will still recommend the game though for people who wish for a free to play version of star citzens dogfight mode.

number of helpful: 6 of 13 people (46%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 25, 2015
												Pure PVP spaceship dogfighting goodness.This is a game for the dedicated PVPer.Star Conflict almost directly takes the model of World of Tanks, with tiered ship progression and team deathmatch style gameplay and builds upon it magnificently. Unlike so many free-to-play games, Star Conflict bends over backwards to avoid pay-to-win issues. You can buy premium ships, but they simply fill slightly different battlefield roles or suit different builds. The meta is constantly evolving as pilots discover new builds and develop new tactics. Daily inter-corporation battles and weekly tournaments ensure that there is plenty of opportunity to sharpen your teeth.The learning curve is steep at times, but perseverance is rewarded!It takes real skill to excel in battle across 3 dimensions. It takes dedication to understand the finer points of equipment configuration. Oh, and it's visually beautiful. I haven't hopped in a tank since I installed Star Conflict.

content:
Posted: July 16, 2014
												Lots of negative reviews from people , who dont understand core mechanics of the game or simply liked the previous versions of it (which were much less playable), for example a guy calls it unfair for lower tiers of gameplay , when people with unlocked implants (talents) from upper tiers come to lower tiers and "ruin the fun for newbies". The guy obviously doesn't know , that implants are also devided in to levels that corelate with ships' levels , and implants only work for similar and further (upper) levels of ships , but for example level 15 implant simply doesn't affect any ship , that is lower then level 15 => level 3 ship only gets the benefits of level 1 , 2 and 3 implants , etc.While there are a decent amount of perium ships , that are often really good at what they are built for the difference in player skill has MUCH more impact on your results in battle , then a premium\regular ship , which are mostly sidegrades that promote slight differences in playstyle.The game is very dynamic and is seriously based on players' skill at aiming , dodgin , understanding and tracking their surroundings in 3d space , etc , but for lots of players its much easier to blame other players for buying a premium ship , then to blame themselves for not being good enough with their aiming.There are also lots of people who say that the game is less fun after the changes it undergone lately.to make my story short - after trying the game for a few days slightly over a year before this review i didn't bother playing it any longer because of serious balance problems and low amount of content other then standart WoT-like short pvp battles. After trying the game after those recent changes have been made - i can't stop playing it every evening with my friends.Give this game a try!

number of helpful: 6 of 13 people (46%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 10, 2015
												This is a surprisingly fair F2P game.  I personally have a lot of fun with it (even when I get my teeth kicked in during a PvP Domination match).  I'll try to break it down, Pros and Cons.Cons:-Upgrades can be bought through GS (Galatic Standards, the in-game currency bought with actual money).-Some ships can only be bought with GS.-No safety net with items (currently).  If you accidentally sell something you didn't mean to, you're out of luck.-Matchmaking doesn't seem to have a balance to it (yet).-Open Space (the Eve/Star Trek: Online-style connected sectors map) is unforgiving.  When Cybers and Biomorphs start showing up, and if you're a new player, you're screwed.Pros:-Galactic Standards can be earned.  It's small, but you get 10 or so for every one or two victories in PvP.  That's a pretty fair shake, considering it's bought with real-world cash.-GS can only be used to upgrade ships by converting Synergy (experience) from an elite ship (max level) into Free Synergy, which is also earned during matches.-Dogfights are fun!  Seriously, there's nothing quite like circling one another in three dimensions, each trying to get behind the other while taking shots or firing missles.  It can be nerve-wracking if you're hull is damaged or your shields are out, and there's a certain thrill to pulling an enemy off one of your teammates mid-fight.  Or, you can sit back in a Harpy, or other long-ranged frigate and take pot shots with your Disintegrator.  Just watch those Command fighters, or Covert Ops.-No ship is the strongest.  Each ship has a role, each role has a purpose, every ship has its strength and weakness.  The combat is more based on skill with your ships than anything.  Upgrades help to increase hull strength and shield capacity, or cooldown time on modules and weapons damage, and later variants of ships in the same role will often have better stats, but no class is omnipotent and even lower-ranked ships can be threats with skill.-The grind for Credits (the techniqually buyable in-game currency, as GS can be exchanged for Credits with an admittedly good rate) is miniscule.  Just a few games and you're raking in hundreds of thousands of Credits for new ships, MK II weapon and module upgrades, and other things.-You don't have to sell ships.  In fact, you can eventually get every ship, all maxed in level with MK IV modules.  You start with three ship slots (these are the ships you can choose during matches or for Open space), and can unlock a fourth with either level or Galactic Standards.-The devs are very active.On a more personal note, the game seems best enjoyed with a friend.  You don't even have to be a super serious player.  It's easy to pick up and put down.  If you have an interest in space dogfights and don't mind luck-based grind for upgrade materials or MILD pay-advantage systems, I would definitely recommend you grab a friend (or a few) and try it out.Until next time, Mercenarcies.

Posted: April 24, 2016
												Looks great, runs great, has plenty of content to offer, but much of it (especially the open-world part) is locked behind a ridiculous grind/pay wall. After 250+ hours, I'm still very 50/50 about this game. The devs recently added a new ship class which basically makes the other 3 classes obsolete, and of course you need to grind a lot to even get your hands on any of these new ships. You can't simply buy them for cash, which is also a 50/50 thing. It's not P2W, but the grind is painful.It would be great if the developers focused on adding new content like maps and game modes, instead of new ships. But there's still plenty of PvP, PvE co-op and open-world fun to be had here.

number of helpful: 6 of 13 people (46%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 11, 2016
												This game was fun, addictive, and... well... like almost every other game thats out there. This games, back when it was good, brought an old concept into new light. When people fought in teams, they fought together as a team. Everyone knew what to do and they would do it in the smartest and, mostly, risk free fashion. People would group together and use each other's abilities to overcome the other team. When someone was in danger of being overtaken 2v1, others would help that person out and push the other team back. Victory felt well desurved and defeat kept you pushing for more. I admit there were problems with the game before, but it was still fun despite. Teamwork was what made the game fun. The game has been change almost completely since then. "change is good," some might say, but with change comes new problems. The game gives people too much power. Strategy isn't what it is anymore. People lack weakness and planning is almost out of the picture. For example: when there was a "tank" that was much more powerful than the rest, the smaller ships would either distract or damage "the tank" so the other ships could destroy "the tank" while its weak. That "tank would deploy counter-measures or bring a few friends along with him to stop these attacks. Most matches now, people will go off on their own or in small squads, and ignore the rest of the team. Now, the problem everyone is talking about: real world cash for ingame money. This game was heading into this direction from the start, but its hit the point of utter annoyance. From over-powered moduals and weapons, to even just wanting to change you name. Sure, if you cram you can get anything without paying for it, but for somethings that would take years. This game was great before, but, like everything I've explained, this has changed. The developers have spent so much time trying to add to the game that they forgot to fix the problems. I wish I could say something good about the game, but with every groundbreaking improvement is an equaly annoying and ruinous problem.

												I rather enjoy this game. It is grindy, but with the variabilty in equipment, abilities, objectives and teams, it is still rather fun. Add the fact that is is Free to Play, and its a definite winner. The game has microtransactions, but you cannot crush people because you bought equipment. (It is simply "different" and not "better.") Thus, since skill and not wealth/equipment make you a winner, I strongly recommend this game. The only real downside is the small number of people, which leads to long wait times (unless you play at certain times).

number of helpful: 4 of 9 people (44%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 23, 2013
 Average F2P-Space arcarde space shooter from Gajin.  Unfortunately, without any depth. The first hours you spend leveling your ships up are very easy and calm. After that, you get into bigger and more interesting fights with more players. Because of the F2P model and the pegi 12 rating this game also attracts lots of kids (The amount of autism in the chat is too damn high) and imbecils, players don't cap empty nodes (like flags in a CTF-game mode) because they don't even care about them or are busy doing whatever they are doing somewhere else which makes a dedicated player rage from time to time.Already mentioned, the game is missing depth. You can upgrade your ships weapons and systems and get new ships through grinding. That's it. There are not even more than 1 main-weapon systems (rockets/torpedos, railguns/lasers) per ship that you can use, at least not from the ships I tested. It contains a PVE mode through that you also can level and grind your ship up which I find very good. There are basically 3 different ship sizes. Big slow ones, medium ones and small agile ones.  My conclusion: Try it out, there's nothing world-changing in this game but it's not bad. I decided not to play it over long terms because I find the stuff the game has offer to me simply boring. The only difference in the higher tier ships and the lower tier ships is that the higher ones have more "grinding levels" (called synergy). They basically look all the same and are the same size while using the same weapons. Why should I bother reaching those ships then?

												Con: The only girls you'll meet in this game are AI's.Pro: For a Sci-fi dodgefight game, this has it all!In the beginning the game seems to have a steep learning curve, but the community is very kind and helpful and for me answered all my questions.There is PvP, with various different modesPvE, with various co-op missionsAnd there is an open world with savezones and free for all zonesYou can chose your ship and upgrade or replace weapons or special abilities on your ship.Tier based, yes, meaning you'll have to play with one ship to advance onwards towards other ships, but there is usually enough to keep you bussy while you progress.You really don't have to pay to play, all that will acomplish is more rewards for acomplishments, making you progress faster.In my opinion, absolutely recommand for any sci-fi lover.

number of helpful: 4 of 9 people (44%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 30, 2014
												I have very mixed feelings about this game, and the only reason I'm giving it thumbs down is that it seriously lacks consistency.It has a lot of potential and I hope they'll introduce some interesting goals and more variety to it, becayse in current state it's simply too grindy and outright boring.After couple hours I feel burned out. All the ships seem like differently colored rehashes of same thing we flew before, just with boosted stats. At first, when you play tutorial and quite fun promissing PvE option, you get the general idea of how Star Conflict is supposed to look. Interceptors are fast and hard to hit, but fragile, gunships are your heavy punchers, and frigates are designed to bring some serious firepower to the frontline being able to withstand some punishment......but the moment we get into PvP this notion goes to absolute ruin. That is because higher ranked players overall have access to equipment with vastly superior stats, meaning you'll spend long minutes sitting on their tail scraping Hit Points with your puny gun, but it often takes three shots to turn your frigate into a flaming husk within a second or two.Unlike with War Thunder, where vehicle and equipment stats are just an cherry on a cake (of your presonal skill) here it's complete oposite. It's all about upgrades, more dps, more energy, more stats, stats, stats and unfortunately it feels more like two metal boxes exchanging stats between eachother.As I wrote there is plenty of ships, sadly most of them are slightly altered models (or not altered at all) of ships we've seen before already, thanks god they have different paintjobs! Upgrade costs are simply horrendous and tier progress it tiring, with a complete lack of interresting content. Game looks AMAZING, the graphic engine is top notch, ship design is perfect, they do look like warmachines and not flying dildoes, like in so many Space-Sims. I love the physics which deals with innertial and thus flight model doesnt feel like planes in Space, but actual spaceships.If only INTERFACE was up to par. The main problem is that in game, where you get into the thick of battle, when all the flashes, explosions, muzzleblasts, thrusters, laser-beams and shiny pulse projectile go across your screen you have NO WAY of telling where the heck is your crossair! It's a tiny cross, two bars, each about half a milimiter thick just vanish in the chaos before your eyes. You can't tell what you're shooting at...I love the immersion factor for what little we've seen so far. The factions are fun, ships have unique feel and style, spacestations are a neat idea, it's just... there's not enough 'fun' to keep me playing. PvE Co-Op was great Idea, doing missions with my friends, flying in organized wings and such, but the moment I went into PvP it sadly turned into a typical World of Stats(tanks)/(in SPACE), an extremely repetitive grindfest, where lower rank players are pretty much free frags, with little to do. And when you get to higher ranks you pretty much wipe everything on the map with little effort. What's then? Grind for a box with better stats? Till you can beat other boxes with higher stats? Grinding for sake of getting a better vehicle to do more grinding and yet better vehicle, and so on, and so on... We are given three factions to choose from, but what's their purpose other than different starting ships? You can fly any faction ship you want anyway, there is no real conflict between them and for most those factions are used to paint the galaxy map somehow in clan-wars, because no other idea seemed valid, I guess. We don't get to explore the factions, they are just there, a symbol that literary means nothing. It is a false pretense we deal with fleshed out setting, in fact factions are nothing more then another grind table masked as a reputation system to unlock 'bigger' stats technology.... You know, so we can get exactly same gun we used to shoot for last week, just with little more damage per second. It feels like in current state, this game is just a load of mechanics that seem interesting at first, but boil down to even more grind, and more, and more, and more grind.Don't get me wrong, this game has GREAT potential, it simply feels like it lacks direction and variety. At current shape and form it get's boring fast, extremely fast! It's hard find reason to support microtransaction system where there's little purpose to keep on playing. Thus, for now, it's Thumbs Down, but I do hope devs (who proved that are capable) can one day introduce new ideas and make the gameplay more interesting.

Posted: March 6, 2015
												Used to play this game a lot back in the beta and it was great, but then the developers went completely ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ and changed almost everything, now the game sucks. Stopped playing months ago but recently installed it again expecting improvement but it's the same♥♥♥♥♥♥it was months ago: unbalanced gameplay, tedious grinding, very bad matchmaking (there's always at least 2 bots on every damn game), biased towards premium members, pointless ranking system, etc.The game lacks a solid system, there's 10 tiers of ships, TEN!! So you get matched with players of your rank or a rank higher, thus unbalancing the game, basically the team with better ships pretty much always wins; but that's not the worst about it, the worst part is that this game follows a system of ship classes, and the outcome of a match highly depends on players choosing a proper class according to the rest of the team, but that NEVER HAPPENS because everyone is focused on leveling up their ships, ignoring any competitiveness the game might have.Conclusion: There's a great idea behind this game, but it has been awfully developed and it's not worth anyone's time.

Posted: February 8, 2014
												A couple of days ago I was told about StarConflict by my friend jonathanwasnthere, after I got used to the controls and gameplay, I really enjoyed the game. It seems like the main objective of the game is to get the next better ship you can get and by doing pvp and pve mission help you get closer to being able to do that. As a begginer, pvp isn't the best gamemode to go into when you just star because there are many other skilled players in better ships who will just blow you up multiple times. pve is alot better to do to get started because you work with others to get though a mission that doesn't involve fighting other people who are most likely more skilled than you, also pve mission normally give off better rewards than pvp.I would definitley recommend this game to other people, it is very good quality for a free game (though there are aspects of the game that you would need to pay for if you want it) and I thing anyone could play this game and enjoy it. The only weakness I have found in this game is pvp miss-matches.Rating: 8.5/10

number of helpful: 3 of 7 people (43%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 27, 2015
												An arcade-esque take on the classic space dogfighting, with a mix of resource management and exploration mixed in. A full 3 axis movement schema allows for some very dynamic, close quarters fighting.  Personally I feel the game is highly undersold, and overshadowed by the breadwinner of the family (war thunder). It's a shame, because it really is an interesting dynamic...and let's face it, space >>>> WW2.* This is not a P2W game, dispite those who claim it is. If anything, it's a "Pay 2 gind...less". The progression in rank can be spead up by spending coin on it, but its not in any way required. In fact, accellerating yourself into a higher tier play may be more detramental than anything -- seat time >> ship type. * It's very casual. Jump in, blow some stuff up for a bit, and log out. No politics, no metagame to really worry about.

												Well i've played Star Conflict  for a while and my verdict is... A GOOD game but want you to BLEED your money hard. I played for FIVE hours straight with prem (+50%) and barely made over 2 000 000 credits and only 15 000 faction rep. (you need 75 k for ONE upgrade of 15 little things you MUST use in battle on ONE of your FOUR ships, and it's only a 3-d lvl tech) You'll need to spend about  30-45 $ monthly to play comfortably or sell your soul to a clan for five hours daily online for a year. Otherwise only grinding for tech four will take more then a two years (If you're normal person who doesn't play more then a two hours and not DAILY). It's game that flyes on a noutbook with 512 mb card on ULTRA HIGH graphics with 30 FPS, because optimization of engine and server is THAT GOOD (Robocraft I look at you) while looking like a YOBA project, but for all nine hells it's want your money bad... I'll give it positive review neverless, because it's a good game, but BE PREPARED!

number of helpful: 3 of 7 people (43%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 30, 2014
												After briefly playing this horrendous F2P game on Steam; I would easily call this a hot contender for the worse F2P game on Steam.While the graphics are the only thing going for this, everything else is shallow and without depth. The ships themselves are lifeless boring designs with no real impact to them other than mindless stats. There is no history to them. There is no feeling of fondness to any of them.You can't customise your ships without resorting to paying gold, the games in-game currency that can be aquired only via special events or buying using real cash. Unlike Warthunder, in which you can customise your ships to some degree without the need to resort to using real cash, in this there is no leeway. Shame because it seems nobody is bothering to customise their ships unless its a high level one and it indiciates a serious flaw with the mechanic.The ships themselves fly like tanks in space; slow and cumbersome. The flight system is nothing to be gawked at and the general feel about this game is that while its F2P, confusing mechanics and layout indicate they really want to pressure you into spending money.The xp system is rather confusing. A mechanic called Synergy that I had trouble understanding. Seems the devs wanted to go with something 'fancy' but ending up with a horrible useless system that makes no sense.While others are saying a recent patch broke this game, I can't see this game improving at all.

number of helpful: 3 of 7 people (43%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 26, 2015
												Ignore the fact that I only have 0.8 hours of playtime.  My account has over 1000 PVP matches prior to the Steam launch.  I  stopped playing over a year ago due to the terrible queue times for matches especially when trying to play in North America (hi, I would like lower than 180-250ms latency in a twitch-based game where reaction time is a big deal).I installed the game again yesterday, tried to get a match on Friday night in USA with Tier 2 (of 5) PVP.  After 10 minutes of no match, I quit the game in disgust.  Tried the same thing today, on a Saturday, could not get a match in over 8 minutes of waiting.  Chat response?  Reset the queue every 2 minutes, repeat until the Gods favor you with a 1v1 match.I loved this game back in the day when I could play it.  Sadly, their terrible match-making system, lack of marketing, and prioritization compared to their other products (hi War Thunder) has crippled what could have been a terrific game.  I absolutely do not recommend this game for anybody in MURICA.

content:
Posted: May 20, 2015
												If you're wondering why the game's store page is rather empty on real information about the game, it's because the game is a pay-to-win grind. The "season two" is nothing but a marketing ploy with no new content from when I last played two years ago. A new map type has been added where you now do your brawling in the midst of two large npc ships which are mirror images of each other instead of the old asteroid field map(s?).This game has three classes of ships: paper, rock, and scissors. There are some instances where your class ship can beat its rival in 1v1 combat, but its either due to the loser being out-leveled, lagged, or a patch over-powered a skill/weapon and will be changed soon.Leveling up your ship until the next tier unlocks for you is a grind in which you will be hopelessly outclassed by people who are twinked and refuse to move on.

content:
Posted: February 21, 2014
												Now, it's certainly no replacement for greats like FreeSpace 2, but as one of a rare genre, it's a very solid space shooter.Everything just feels good. Ships are different enough that it's fun to use different ones. Graphics are surprisingly good for a free game.There's really no feeling of needing to pay for anything. Paid items and ships let you replace some time spent earning credits, but they aren't necessary to win by any means. Most of the negative reviews say there's too much grinding... But what they call grinding = playing the game. That's it. It's not like you need to quickly "finish grinding" to get to something else. So far, I'm quite enjoying leveling up every different ship, seeing how they handle differently, rather than rushing to the highest rank right away.

number of helpful: 2 of 5 people (40%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 25, 2015
												Star Conflict. A game I noticed over one year ago because of the gameplay. While most games that let you fly let you know if you're upside down, Star Conflict uses the benefit of no gravity to remove these boundries. The missions are (usually) fast, there is not much chatting and there are no cinematic clips for each mission. While the game is simple to understand and to play, it still holds many challenges for advanced players. There are countless ships to choose from (if you have unlocked them) and there is at least one ship for every type of playstyle. Allthough repeating the same missions over and over to unlock new ships gets boring, you can always grab a friend and kick it up a notch. The fact that the game is free to play only enforces it's awesomeness. The game is at number three of my most played steam games with 66 hours at the moment (2. is GTA V with 230 hours and 1. is Skyrim with 315 hours) and I enjoyed every moment of it. The fact that there are in-game-purchases (aka DLC) is acceptable and you can really live without the purchases if you want to. So to conclude this review, Star Conflict is an awesome game which should not be underestimated. I definetly recommend the game and since it's free, you should really at least give it a try.

content:
Posted: January 4, 2014
												A very fun, clean, well made, and execllent game. Star Conflict is a space shooter, filled with action packed games with simple yet challenging objectives. Star Conflict will alsways keep you entertained and engaged. Star Conflict offers different types of combat space ships, from Long Range Frigates to Recon Interceptors for the close up type. Tired of fighting players in PvP? Star  Conflict offers PvE, where a squad of 4 people are pitted against bots while they complete objectives.Smooth, clean, and engaging.Star Conflict has something for everyone to enjoy.

												Since getting this, i've been quite hooked on it. It's great fun to fly in space with different "modules" on your ships and the game modes are diverse enough to keep someone playing for a long while. I'm only second tier i think in terms of ship and the first tier is practiaclly the same game type played on about 2 or 3 maps it was so much fun and satisfying manuvring your ship and trying to outflank your enemy although not easy to do with lagg of my caliber.Even as just a beginner i would reccomend this game as it's great fun and quite satisfying if your looking for a "freelander-esqu" game in control with a variety of special modules and different weapon damages to give a good dynamic to the battlefield in which you fly.

content:
Posted: May 3, 2014
												Star Conflict is great, but this is where you might question me. Tell me that I'am wrong. Partially, only a few hours ago of gameplay, I would have told you that this game is♥♥♥♥♥♥ This game has a terribly slow and boring at the first hour or 2. Starting ships are dreadfully slow. Frigates are basically floating cans in space (Do they even have any thrusters on them?). Speed is a very important part of the game in terms of balancing the homing missle, which are far too effective early game. Basically. The first 2 hours or so of the game is♥♥♥♥♥♥ Until you get to tier 4, you will have no fun, or somewhat sometimes glimpses of fun.After the 2 hours I have noticed the sudden boost of variaty of weapons (It seemed like from the usual 3, it boosted to 12 or so, don't take my word for it) The ships, especially the medium fighter ships started to get speed, actual mobility, strafing was alright. In fact, the speed of the tiny ships was crazy, which was lovely. Even earning money was not a grind anymore.Basically, the very start of the game is a slow grind. Get to tier 4 and WOO FUN TIMES.

number of helpful: 2 of 5 people (40%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 8, 2014
												Been playing Star Conflict for quite a long time.The basis of the game comes down to grinding. This game is not pay 2 win, but pay for shortcuts. Paid ships even are weaker than ships at the same level.Once you have gotten past the first hours of getting a decent arsenal of ships, the game becomes very fun- as each different class of ships has a flexible role.You want to play CoD and snipe?Sure- you can even use a guided missile if you suck at leading your shotsYou want to heal all 15 of your teammates while lasering your enemy to death?Sure- you even get little drones to heal even moreYou want to♥♥♥♥♥♥off snipers and melt them to nothing within 3 seconds?Sure- you also get to pick up kills if you want with a 10 second burn for those who chase you.You want to take the heat and hold up against 10 ships worth of artillery?Sure- you even get to zap anything within 3K meters range of you for those who get close.You want to zoom around the map and give away the positions of the enemy team?Sure- you could even steal that engi's shields to kill the tank while you're at it.With a huge variety of ships the game almost fills up the grindfest with content you can have fun with.To a lesser extent of what Dota2 and League have, you get matched with different people so no two matches will play out the same.With also the faction system, you can band together (once you get a high enough ranked ship) for more structured games.This game is also getting a lot of attention by the team, so expect frequent updates and fixes.

content:
Posted: January 1, 2015
												If you ever heard of Freelancer, then this game is its spiritual successor. Spaceships, adrenalinic battles, dogfighting with bullets and plasma and explosions everywhere. It's fun, and actually free (played the first 150 hours without spending a dime and actually enjoying the game, never felt pressed to pay for something). Good balance in PvP, customization and -some rpg-like elements give a nice set of choices, which suits every playstyle in meaningful and different ways. You can play at your own pace, it's easy to learn, the community is friendly and willing to help new players to learn their basics.Sometimes it feels grindy, but shiny things will eventually come with just playing.Maybe it loses some of its scope when reaching endgame, which actually consists just in acquiring the best ships, but it's still a beta! I see new content periodically, not That Much often, but it comes out with a really good quality.This year was rich of surprises, most notably the addition of free sectors exploration (which has still a lot of potential to develop further) and enrichment of pve. 


YouTube™ Video: Video Blog "Star Conflict" 2014 

			Views: 15,393		

			In this video blog we are summing up all we've done in 2014. You can find links to our game below: http://star-conflict.com/ http://store.steampowered.com/app/212070		

Bonus points because I see developers quite often in the forums, and steam community is supported too.I'll definitetly keep playing, and I'd really want to see more weapons, ships, and obviously more and more people who supports this game!See you in battle, pilot!

content:
Posted: March 1, 2015
												After reading many negative post, i want to start with this:* i do not have any contact with the admins. Never seen one of them.I'm not a hardcore gamer with so much free time, so i just want to blow things up once a week... Because of that, i stayed in T2 (rank 5..7) ships. With ~35-45 hours of game, you can get 3 different, well equiped T2 ships. T2 ships are good enough for having fun.Why i gave positive for the game:+ looks awsome, and we got Linux port+ truly 3D flight mechanics. You can go up and down and roll and... So it's not restricted in movement at all. (not like STO)+ the ship classes are really different, with different play style requirement.+ ship equipment from weapons to utily systems are fully custsomizable+ needs some brain to know how to shoot dow different ships and how to stay alive+ also needs some brain to know how to use your ship+ easy to learn and get new things (at least in T1, T2). I had great fun with this game.Cons:-minimap are a bit useless, especialy in beacon hunt maps.-Linux port are still needs some performance tuning, but it's getting better than the initial release. A Radeon R7 260x was not enough to get smooth framerate at medium settings in 1920*1080 with latest Catalyst driver. (I know about issues with the old X11 drm, it can hit performance hard)

number of helpful: 2 of 5 people (40%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 16, 2015
												I have played this game before on a different steam account. So, I decided to play it again. There are a few points I would like to address.1). If you played Warthunder and enjoyed it, and you also like Sci-Fi games, this is for you. It was made by the same developers that made Warthunder, World of Tanks etc.2). This game features, PvP, PvE and Free roaming in the galaxy. Now, I have not explored the galaxy, I just went around for like 5-10 minutes, so I cannot tell you how big it is or what exactly you can do in it. You will have to go explore it.3). PvP is like Warthunder, but with spaceships, PvE is a co-operative mission with 3 other pilots, it's like Warframe, but with spaceships.4). The graphics of this game are pretty good. I have my settings all on the highest possibly, with the highest AA, everything turned on, and I am getting a solid 60fps no matter what is going on. I am running a GTX 660 oc and an i7-3770. 5). The controls are hard to get used to, and because it is 0 gravity, the space ship will behave eratically if you do sudden movements and turn suddenly, it makes me dizzy sometimes. So if you are the one that gets sick easily, stay away.All in all, I would rate this game 8/10.

number of helpful: 2 of 5 people (40%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 12, 2015
												Hey!I got to admit that this game is a lot of grind, some admins might be abusing, the game is full of idiots who don't know how to play, premium ships seem to be overpowered at first, ... (If you want a list of all the bad things about this game, look some "not recommended"-rewievs)BUT:This game is so much fun to me! To be honest, sometimes all those bad players drive me crazy (especially in PvE) and premiumship users got me mad in PvP.But as soon as you find one of the bad players flying around with a Premium ship and you just own them like any other player, you realize that the premiumships are the same like "normal" ships (some stats are better, some are worse) and the only advantage you have is that the ship comes with maxed level.What makes sense, since you don't pay to get an overpowered ship (that would be boring for most people), but to just skip the grinding-process!So basicly it's not pay-to-win... it's more like pay-to-avoid-the-grind-but-actually-miss-a-lot-of-the-games-charm  (woaaah that escaleted quickly...)If you pay you just lose the feeling you really progressed, 'cause you just bought and not "earned" it :)About abusive Admins and foreign laguages in the english chat:Most of these admins kinda got kicked in their♥♥♥♥♥(I am not hearing much of abuse lately), and about 3 or 4 sentences in the englishchat in foreign language and you get muted, that's my experience so far.Oh not to forget the Noo... Noooot so skilled players ;Dyou have them in every game with a multiplayer that just randomly matches you with idio... , foo... , ... ... other players.Just shake it of and try to carry the game, due to the matchmaking there are as much <insert an nice word for noob here> on the other team, so it's basically fair.Like I said at the beginning, this game is pretty fun to me and i highly recommend that to anyone who's is interested in "space-simulators" (I don't know what to call it >.>)!Two more things i got to admit, that are "bad" in this game:Well the matchmaking is not "bad" it's just unoptimized... yeah unoptimized sounds good so far (you may experience long waiting times to find a game and the way the teams are balanced is kinda crap - look it up in the forum for more info)Second thing: You don't have "realistic momentum" in this game. To be honest, implementing that would be to challenging for most casual players. But I am kind of a freak when it comes to flying, so it's just my personal wish ^^.--------------------Well then thank you for reading and have a nice day! (/night for all the nightowls ;D )

number of helpful: 2 of 5 people (40%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 19, 2013
												Star Conflict is a third-person space ship combat game with upgradeable ships and weapons. This game is quite the thrill ride, with its increadably smooth controls and fast-paced combat system. First, the ships. You can choose from three basic classes: Scout, Fighter, and I believe Freighter. I'm probably wrong on the third one, just know that they are massive ships. These classes are the usual fast but weak, medium sheilding and average, and slow as hell but tough as nails. They are mostly well ballanced. The weapons boil down to three different types of gun: plasma, laser, and regular. Again, probably wrong on the third one. They all handle differently, each with their own strengths and weaknesses. Plasma is for removing sheilds, laser is direct damage, and regular is... I don't remember. Sorry. But this relatively simple system is perfect because it emphasizes the beauty of this game: the skill of the pilots. Dodging missiles and running down scouts is a feeling that I have never felt before in a game. It gives you an amazing feeling of success as you bob and weave through enemy lines with your fellow pilots, and when you pull off a maneuver, you feel like a badass. But the learning curve is certainly there, as most of your enjoyment will focus on how well you can pilot your craft. There are threemodes (that come to mind), the standard death match, team death match, and commander. Deathmatch, it's just your regular deathmatch, nothing special. Same for team, no real innovation (again, focus on combat) Commander is where the real fun begins. This mode is based on destroying the enemies commander while protecting yours, as when the commander is gone, you no longer can respawn. This creates some real tension as, even if your commander is gone, because of the enormous focus on combat, it is possible to turn the battle around. Overall, this is a very fun game with beautiful aesthetics and a solid combat system. And it's free, so, try it out when you have the time.

content:
Posted: November 5, 2014
												Great game if you miss things like Freelancer, Darkstar One or the Space Combat in Star Wars Galaxies (So much Win!)I nice Free To Play with great graphics, solid sound and arcade-style Gameplay. Skirmishes give you a good 10 minute Dogfight or so to get some quick $$$ / Ship XP. Ship levelling allows you to progress into the ships / styles that you wish. Free days as a "Premium" member give you XP and Credit boosts and if you enjoy the game, $10 for a month worth of premium membership plus some leftovers to trick out your favorite ship are a small price to pay for a game that will give you a good Flight-Sim Style PVP fix that leaves you wanting more.Add on to this a PVE option to farm materials, credits and simply change up the pace and explore the "World" makes this a great little game for anyone who loves a good spaceflight sim.Give it a whirl!3354472FB65C99E6611FFFABC49649C1Here's my invite code. Come Fly a Few skirmishes. :)

number of helpful: 2 of 5 people (40%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 4, 2015
												This game has a lot of potential.  The combat is incredibly fun and addictive, and the selection of ships makes team play a lot more fun.  This game has all the mechanics to be the best space combat game ever.My only complaints are the long wait times before getting into a PvP or PvE battle, and the utter lack of balance in the resulting PvP battles.  Kills are Pareto-distributed, indicating that the most utter n00b gets paired up against complete aces.  It might be more fun and interesting to balance the teams.Having a more concrete story/objective for single-player mode would also make the game more fun.  As it is, it's just scavenging.And for G*d's sake, fix the battle finder so I don't have to wait a whole freaking 2 minutes before I start a battle!

number of helpful: 2 of 5 people (40%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 25, 2015
												Star Conflict. A game I noticed over one year ago because of the gameplay. While most games that let you fly let you know if you're upside down, Star Conflict uses the benefit of no gravity to remove these boundries. The missions are (usually) fast, there is not much chatting and there are no cinematic clips for each mission. While the game is simple to understand and to play, it still holds many challenges for advanced players. There are countless ships to choose from (if you have unlocked them) and there is at least one ship for every type of playstyle. Allthough repeating the same missions over and over to unlock new ships gets boring, you can always grab a friend and kick it up a notch. The fact that the game is free to play only enforces it's awesomeness. The game is at number three of my most played steam games with 66 hours at the moment (2. is GTA V with 230 hours and 1. is Skyrim with 315 hours) and I enjoyed every moment of it. The fact that there are in-game-purchases (aka DLC) is acceptable and you can really live without the purchases if you want to. So to conclude this review, Star Conflict is an awesome game which should not be underestimated. I definetly recommend the game and since it's free, you should really at least give it a try.
